Title: Experiment Report on Moire Stone
Text:
Hardness: 6
Density: 3.0-3.5 g/cm?
Compressive Strength: 3000-5000 kg/cm?

The specimen is named Moire Stone, characterized by its fine structure, high hardness, and strong compressive strength. It exhibits excellent chemical stability and can withstand extreme temperature variations.
Moire Stones are widely distributed in the Gorges of Spirits, forming large-scale deposits that faciliate easy mining. Sizable blocks can be easily mined. All these factors make Moire Stones excellent construction materials suitable for large-scale sculptures, exterior walls of buildings, and hard paving.

Note: It is used in the construction of Jinzhou and the creation of the Sentinel sculpture.
